visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a chart with the following specifications: Chart type: line and column, Chart title: 'Monthly Weather Data', Axes and labels styling: Use a dark blue color for the title, labels, and axes with a font size of 14px, Data series: Include two series, one for 'Temperature' with line type and data [29.9, 71.5, 106.4, 129.2, 144.0, 176.0, 135.6, 148.5, 216.4, 194.1, 95.6, 54.4], and another for 'Rainfall' with column type and data [194.1, 95.6, 54.4, 29.9, 71.5, 106.4, 129.2, 144.0, 176.0, 135.6, 148.5, 216.4], Custom colors: Use a gradient from light blue to dark blue for the 'Temperature' series and a gradient from light green to dark green for the 'Rainfall' series, Additional configurations: Set the chart background to a light gray color, add a legend at the bottom of the chart, and set the chart margins to 50 pixels on all sides.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a dual-series chart displaying 'Temperature' as a line series and 'Rainfall' as a column series. The chart title is set to 'Monthly Weather Data' with a dark blue color and a font size of 14px. The x-axis and y-axis labels, along with their titles, are styled with the same dark blue color and font size. The data series for 'Temperature' and 'Rainfall' are provided with their respective data points, and custom gradient colors are applied to each series to enhance visual distinction. The chart background is set to a light gray color, and the legend is positioned at the bottom of the chart for better readability. The chart margins are set to 50 pixels on all sides to ensure adequate spacing around the chart elements.
